name: Hilton Orlando

reviews.title: Excellent value
reviews.text: Close to all attractions with a great pool and ameneties that means you can enjoy a day just at the hotel between parks. Spencer's steakhouse is great and if you are a Brit you might be happy sharing courses.
Great location, good big rooms and all I now expect from billion. Worth getting on the Hilton honours reward programme as free wifi and breakfast costs would've added up.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better

reviews.text: Stopped in on a quick business trip at this hotel. Excellent meeting facilities, great open space wtih a very modern feel. You didn't get a sense that you were in Orlando (lots of kids running around with tourist-type parents) at this facility. Top notch dining options and good service.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel in Orlando

reviews.text: While I haven't stayed at any competing hotels around the convention center, I see no reason to try anywhere else. Room was spacious, comfortable, and entire hotel was spotless (even in corners). Staff was hospitable with even security and parking lot attendants providing helpful suggestions/directions. Check-in was not seemless but mistakes were promptly fixed. Using Disney's resorts as a benchmark, the Orlando Hilton is a luxury hotel with fixtures/decor and cleanliness that is comparable to the Grand Floridian and hospitality that's good but not exceptional.
reviews.title: great convention center hotel for families

reviews.text: Positives: Great pool with separate areas for a lazy river, slide, water basketball, zero-depth entry and a quiet pool. Despite the size of the hotel, the pool area was not overly crowded but there was a short wait for towels. The hotel has a quarter mile jogging trail, putting golf course, basketball court, ping pong and fooze ball tables.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Our stay at the hilton was wondetful! We came for a weekend getaway, without our kids. The rooms and staff at the hotel are wonderful. Paul, with valet service, went the extra mile to make our stay special. He sent chocolate covered strawberries to our room with a note stating he hopes we have a nice relaxing weekend without our kids. It was so sweet!
reviews.title: Great service - Wonderful staff!!

reviews.text: I loved my little get away at this hotel. My son came up to see me and we did not have to leave the resort. We stayed by the pool both days and enjoyed the lazy river and the water slide. I was upgraded to a "Pure Room" (at least I think thats what it is called.) It was nice. Easy breathing thats for sure. I am not going to try to explain all the benefits of the allergy free room. The lady at the front desk explained it but my mind was about getting to the pool so I did not pay too much attention. Here is a link though if anyone is interested. http://hhonors1.hilton.com/en_US/hh/landing/hww_pure/index.do
reviews.title: I loved it --> Work/Play/Relax

reviews.text: Anyways . I truly loved it here. I could eat, go to the spa, hang by the pool where kids were fully entertained and enjoy my son without leaving the property and that was my goal.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

reviews.text: What a Beautiful Resort! Rooms were average, but the resort itself was fantastic! The lobby is gorgeous, the kids had a blast in the pool. Lazy river was a huge hit, as was the slide.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Loved the pools, waterslide, lazy river! Kids would've spent all day in the pool area. Restaurants & bar pricey but Orlando seems to be that way across the board...
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: This is a new hotel (about a year old)....Beautiful in every way. Staff is super and well trained. Rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. Expect to pay a bit more for food here, yet the quality is very good. Extra charge for parking, tennis rackets and golf clubs (as expected). First class hotel all the way!
reviews.title: Super property

reviews.text: It is beautiful! Such a great pool area with hot tub and lazy river! The staff is so nice. The rooms are clean,comfortable and classy! I went for a long weekend with my family and we had a great time. The Tropics restaurant by the pool had delicious food! Can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: love it!

reviews.text: The pictures don't do it justice. There are basketball and tennis courts, executive putting greens, and an adult "quiet pool" in addition to the fun pool with water slide and basketball. Also, included pool tables and foose ball tables. The pool tables are well used. The only thing missing was a ping pong table.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!

reviews.text: I find myself traveling to Orlando about every 4-6 weeks for work, and always stay here now. After trying several different hotels in the area, including some that are rated 5-star (i.e., J.W. Marriott Grande Lakes), I found this one to be the most consistently nice. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well-furnished, the spa is superb, and the lazy river is great for kids and adults alike. And if you order room service, get the salad with strawberries. I do not usually like salads, but this one is DELICIOUS!
reviews.title: Great for business, families, or pleasure!

reviews.text: I just returned from a 4 day stay at this property for the National Plastics Expo that took place in the attached Orlando Convention Center. I didn't want to leave the property! It was so relaxing, the property has 3 outdoor pools, 2 hot tubs, 3 basketball courts, 6 putting greens, a 1/4 mile jogging track, a tennis court, and 2 gas fire places. There is music playing around the pool and fire pit areas all day. The service was outstanding at the outdoor pool bar/restaurant, as well as in Spencer's restaurant, and David's club. The rooms looked brand new because of Hilton's commitment to continuous upkeep. My closet interior paint had just been touched up when I arrived, unfortunately, I had already hung up my clothes in the closet before Lillian (a maintenance tech) nocked on my door to tell me to be careful of the fresh paint in our closet. Lillian took it on herself to turn my bad situation into an opportunity for Hilton's service to shine. Lillian called down to houskeeping and had my shirt dry cleaned at no charge, and it was back in my room the next morning. Although the Hilton was at the top of my price range, I plan to go back with my family someday soon, so that they too can experience the relaxation and service that I experienced.
reviews.title: AWESOME RELAXATION

reviews.text: There is nothing bad about this hotel other than the $13/night parking. I completely enjoyed my stay at the Hilton. The grounds are beautiful, the staff very professional and the rooms were exceptional. I will gladly make Hilton my choice again when visiting Orlando.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
To quote lil Jon, "WHAT? & YEAH!"
reviews.text: Had a great time. Service was outstanding from the time my wife and I arrived. Definitely worth the $ and we will return. Spencer's was out of this world, food, service, and atmosphere were just right. Would have paid more if I had to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I just enjoyed our 3ed visit to this wonderful resort/hotel. As frequent visitors to the Orlando parks we find that the hotels location is ideal. The property is minutes from Sea World and the International Drive attractions. Located just 1 mile from I-4 it is 5 minutes to either Disney or Universal studios. It is also a few blocks from the B-Line, if traveling from the airport (MCO). The super convenient parking garage is situated a few feet from the front desk. Check-in is very fast and professional. This hotel is also attached to the Orlando convention Center and also offers great conference facilities. The rooms are very large with great bedding, a fantastic flat-screen TV, and upscale bath amenities. We also love the pool for its lazy river and the zero-entry swimming area. The executive golf course is also enjoyable. We have dined at all of the dining venues offered by the Hilton. The sports bar is great as well as the coffee shop and pool-side bar. The surprise for my family was how good their steak and chop house is. Spencer’s is located off the main lobby for dinner. We dined here this past Saturday and the food and service were astronomical. We enjoyed excellent salads, dry-aged beef and lamb, and desserts. The price was about $160 for two but it was worth it! I highly recommend the Hilton Orlando for your next trip to the Orlando area.
reviews.title: A great resort for serious relaxation!

reviews.text: My visit to this Hilton was a mix of business and family time. I was to attend a convention at the Orange County Convention Center, which is connected by a covered walkway, this was real nice.
reviews.title: Best Hilton I have been to

reviews.text: Let me comment on Matt, one of the valet guys. He was very helpful without being a pain and appearing to look for a tip. These guys on the car line know how to get cars in and out, keep the lanes clear all the while being polite and personable. A tough combination.
reviews.title: Great Staycation!

description: Hilton Orlando is an upscale, award winning luxury hotel and is centrally located to everything that Orlando has to offer. Hilton Orlando received a AAA Four Diamond rating for its luxurious amenities and top-notch service and has recently been named the best Hilton in the Americas (over 500 rooms) for the third year in a row from Hilton Worldwide for its overall performance and outstanding customer service. Amenities and services include seven fresh and creative dining options including Spencer’s for Steaks and Chops, David’s Club, Tropics, and The Marketplace. For recreation, we offer a resort pool, quiet pool, whirlpools, cabanas, lazy river, water slide, basketball/volleyball/tennis courts, golf putting course, 1/4 mile outdoor running track, fire pits, full service spa, and a 4,000 sq ft fitness center.The Hilton Orlando is located just 15 minutes away from the Orlando International Airport and is central to all of the major Orlando attractions including SeaWorld® Orlando, Universal Studios Florida® and Walt Disney World® Resort theme parks. Pointe Orlando and Sand Lake Road are minutes away, offering some of the finest dining and entertainment in the region. Two upscale shopping outlets and the Mall of Millenia are also nearby. For convention attendees, the hotel is connected to the Orange County Convention Center. Consistent with the hotel’s contemporary design, upscale accommodations furnish the interior of the 1,417 well-appointed guestrooms, including 51 suites. In-room amenities include the Hilton’s Serenity Bed, in-room refrigerators, Cuisinart dual-cup single-brew coffee maker, desk area with nesting table and Herman Miller ergonomic chair, programmable safes and large 37” LCD TVs.
